text: w3schools is not an appropriate measure for the general population.   It's a fine metric for what browsers web developers are using.  Looking at Wikimedia's traffic should be much more indicative of the general population.
that's why i added the Wikipedia article
I think Gaston's article is flawed as well, Firefox has not fallen that far (yet).
and Shareaholic is indicitive of the general pop?
I know, I shared that out of frustration with FF and it was a poor choice of article in retrospect.
My original (unstated) point was that in my experience as a front-end guy FF has been extremely buggy in the last months. So buggy that it reminded me of IE.
I would agree with Gaston that FF has been presenting more and more problems.
I would argue that Chrome would present problems if people used Firefox for development
